edu.cuny.ai.learning
Class NArmedBanditLearner

java.lang.Object
  edu.cuny.ai.learning.AbstractLearner
      edu.cuny.ai.learning.NArmedBanditLearner
All Implemented Interfaces:
DiscreteLearner, ExposedStimuliResponseLearner, Learner, StimuliResponseLearner, Parameterizable, Prototypeable, Resetable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class NArmedBanditLearner
extends AbstractLearner
implements ExposedStimuliResponseLearner, java.io.Serializable, Prototypeable

A learner that implements a solution framework for the n-armed bandit problem described in Section 2.2, Sutton and Barto's RL book.

Parameters

base.k
int >=1		 (number of actions)
base.action_choosing
name of class, inheriting ActionChoosingPolicy		 (the policy used to choose an action out of an action set based on their expected returns)
base.return_updating
name of class, inheriting ReturnUpdatingPolicy		 (the policy used to calculate the expected returns of actions)

Default Base

n_armed_bandit_learner

Version:
$Revision: 1.6 $
Author:
Jinzhong Niu
See Also:

getLearningDelta

public double getLearningDelta()
Description copied from interface: Learner
Return a value indicative of the amount of learning that occured during the last iteration. Values close to 0.0 indicate that the learner has converged to an equilibrium status.

Specified by:
getLearningDelta in interface Learner
